text:
Madison Avenue at S.W. corner of 47th Street, showing the Ritz-Carlton Hotel. The stores along the Madison Avenue front were added to the building as alterations in 1921, when the Avenue was widened.

1921-1922.

Gift of E.M. Jenks.

297 Madison Avenue, at S.E. corner of 47th Street, showing building under construction. The open freight yards of New York Central Railroad in background were later built over. Building in background, seen through 47th Street, is the Grand Central Palace. About 1922.

Madison Avenue, east side, between 47th and 48th Streets.
About 1922.

Madison Avenue at N.W. corner of 47th Street.
September 2, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

Madison Avenue, west side, from 47th to 48th Streets, Buildings were demolished and replaced inside of one year.
February 6, 1928.

P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

General View Midtown Manhattan, East 50's: Looking northeastward across midtown Manhattan toward the Queensboro Bridge from Madison Avenue and East 47th Street. In the center of view 1 is the Shelton Hotel at Lexington Avenue and East 49th Street.

View 2 is east from East 52nd Street (left) and Madison Avenue, across the roof of the Hotel Ambassador.

View 3 is northeast from the same point as view 2.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: February 1, 1929
Views 2,3: March 4, 1930
title: General view - Midtown Manhattan - East 50s.

text:

title: General view - Midtown Manhattan - East 50s.

text:
Madison Avenue, west side north from 47th Street. Shows buildings between 49th and 50th Streets which were wrecked that summer, and just beyond them may be seen the roof of the Lady Chapel of St. Patrick's Cathedral.

April 27, 1930.

P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

47th Street, north side, west from and including Madison Avenue. The tall building in the centre is 580 Fifth Avenue at the N.W. corner of 47th Street.

P. L. Sperr.

April 4, 1932.
